intro: Andryala lyrata var. incana, commonly known as the woolly leafed andryala, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands or shrublands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
